caption.body: This is your last week to see “San Francisco Opera: A Centennial Celebration” on display, post-security, in Harvey Milk Terminal 1, but don’t fret! If you’re looking for more Opera, fall down the rabbit hole! The San Francisco Opera is celebrating their centennial online with “Streaming the First Century!” Featuring 25 audio artifacts from previous seasons, archival interviews, newly captured conversations, historical essays, and more, “Streaming the First Century” has hours upon hours of archival Opera performances. Highlights include Turandot with tenor Luciano Pavarotti, a clip of the inaugural performance of Puccini’s Tosca in the War Memorial Opera House, staring Claudia Muzio with Company founder Gaetano Merola conducting, and Il Trovatore with Leontyne Price. Check out “Streaming the First Century” on the SF Opera's website: https://www.sfopera.com/seasons/2022-23-season/streaming-the-first-century/down-the-rabbit-hole/  “San Francisco Opera: A Centennial Celebration” on display for just this week, post-security, in Harvey Milk Terminal 1. https://bit.ly/SFOperaCentennial   #SFOperaCentennial #Opera San Francisco Opera
